meta.authoritativeSource: Figure 4 (Sheets 1–4) Quantitative Baseline Deficiency Flow Diagram

F4_S0_Q_ENTRY_TYPE.title: Assessment Entry
F4_S0_Q_ENTRY_TYPE.question: Which Figure 4 entry best matches what you are assessing?

F4_S0_Q_CAPABILITY_CONTEXT.title: Capability Context
F4_S0_Q_CAPABILITY_CONTEXT.question: Is the System Under Test a new capability for the fleet which is not replacing an existing less capable capability?

F4_S0_INFO_NEW_CAPABILITY.title: New Equipment / New Capability
F4_S0_INFO_NEW_CAPABILITY.body: New capability selected (NEW path). Continue to Step 1 (Capability Production Requirements Assessment).

F4_S0_INFO_IPR_CAPABILITY.title: Existing Capability Replacement / Improvement
F4_S0_INFO_IPR_CAPABILITY.body: Replacing/improving an existing capability selected (IPR path). Continue to Step 1 (Capability Production Requirements Assessment).

F4_S0_INFO_SUPPORT_ITEM.title: Support Equipment / Support System Item
F4_S0_INFO_SUPPORT_ITEM.body: Support equipment baseline deficiency flow selected. Continue to Step 1 (Support System/Item Development Assessment).

F4_NEW_S1_Q_TOTAL_LOSS.title: Step 1 — Total Loss of Functionality (NEW)
F4_NEW_S1_Q_TOTAL_LOSS.question: Do you have total loss of system functionality? (New capabilities are not available.)

F4_NEW_S1_Q_LOSS_GE_50.title: Step 1 — ≥ 50% Loss (NEW)
F4_NEW_S1_Q_LOSS_GE_50.question: Do you have a ≥ 50% loss of primary application functionality or performance resulting in users unable to perform their normal functions, or a Major Feature/Product Failure with partial loss of secondary capabilities/features? (Inconvenient workaround exists, or no workaround exists.)

F4_NEW_S1_Q_LOSS_25_49.title: Step 1 — 25–49% (Partial) Loss (NEW)
F4_NEW_S1_Q_LOSS_25_49.question: Do you have a 25–49% (partial) loss of primary application functionality or performance resulting in users unable to perform their normal functions? (Inconvenient workaround exists.)

F4_NEW_S1_Q_DEGRADED_LT_24.title: Step 1 — Degraded (< 24% Degradation) (NEW)
F4_NEW_S1_Q_DEGRADED_LT_24.question: Do you have a degraded (less than 24% degradation) primary application functionality or performance resulting in a low number of users unable to perform their normal functions? (No impact to their normal functions, and a workaround exists.)

F4_NEW_S1_Q_TOTAL_PRIMARY_BELOW_THRESHOL.title: Step 1 — Total Primary Functionality but Below Threshold (NEW)
F4_NEW_S1_Q_TOTAL_PRIMARY_BELOW_THRESHOL.question: Do you have total primary functionality or performance, but less than the threshold requirements is required, and no workaround is required? (All existing capabilities exist with no problems.)

F4_IPR_S1_Q_TOTAL_LOSS.title: Step 1 — Total Loss of Functionality (IPR)
F4_IPR_S1_Q_TOTAL_LOSS.question: Do you have total loss of system functionality? (New and previously existing capabilities are not available.)

F4_IPR_S1_Q_LOSS_GE_75.title: Step 1 — ≥ 75% Loss (IPR)
F4_IPR_S1_Q_LOSS_GE_75.question: Do you have a ≥ 75% loss of primary application functionality or performance resulting in users unable to perform their normal functions, or a Major Feature/Product Failure with partial loss of existing (regressive) capabilities? (Inconvenient workaround exists, or no workaround exists.)

F4_IPR_S1_Q_LOSS_50_74_NO_REGRESSION.title: Step 1 — 50–74% (Partial) Loss (IPR)
F4_IPR_S1_Q_LOSS_50_74_NO_REGRESSION.question: Do you have a 50–74% (partial) loss of primary application functionality or performance resulting in users unable to perform their normal functions, or a Major feature/product failure, but no loss of existing capabilities? (Inconvenient workaround exists.)

F4_IPR_S1_Q_DEGRADED_NO_EXISTING_LOSS.title: Step 1 — Degraded Primary Application (IPR)
F4_IPR_S1_Q_DEGRADED_NO_EXISTING_LOSS.question: Do you have a degraded primary application functionality or performance resulting in a low number of users unable to perform their normal functions? (No loss of existing capabilities and/or secondary feature/product intermittently functioning; with a workaround that exists.)

F4_S2_DEF_SEVERE.title: Severe Deficiency
F4_S2_DEF_SEVERE.body:
Severe Deficiency.

Correct prior to ship or system Deployment.

F4_S2_Q_MISSIONLOSS_50_75.title: Mission Loss Range (Critical Impact)
F4_S2_Q_MISSIONLOSS_50_75.question: Do you have a 50–75% loss of mission capability due to the Critical SUT impact?

F4_S2_DEF_MAJOR1.title: Major 1 Deficiency
F4_S2_DEF_MAJOR1.body:
Major 1 Deficiency.

Correct prior to ship or system Deployment.
Correct prior to fleet introduction.

F4_S2_Q_MISSIONLOSS_25_49.title: Mission Loss Range (Serious Impact)
F4_S2_Q_MISSIONLOSS_25_49.question: Do you have a 25–49% loss of mission capability due to the Serious SUT impact?

F4_S2_DEF_MAJOR2.title: Major 2 Deficiency
F4_S2_DEF_MAJOR2.body:
Major 2 Deficiency.

Correct prior to fleet introduction.
Correct prior to next program build/or software release.

F4_S2_Q_MISSIONLOSS_15_24.title: Mission Loss Range (Moderate Impact)
F4_S2_Q_MISSIONLOSS_15_24.question: Do you have a 15–24% loss of mission capability due to the Moderate SUT impact?

F4_S2_DEF_MAJOR3.title: Major 3 Deficiency
F4_S2_DEF_MAJOR3.body:
Major 3 Deficiency.

Correct prior to next program build/or software release.
Correct as soon as possible.

F4_S2_Q_MISSIONLOSS_0_14.title: Mission Loss Range (Minor Impact)
F4_S2_Q_MISSIONLOSS_0_14.question: Do you have a 0–14% loss of mission capability due to the Minor SUT impact?

F4_S2_DEF_MINOR.title: Minor Deficiency
F4_S2_DEF_MINOR.body:
Minor Deficiency.

Correct as soon as possible.
Correct as soon as practicable.

F4_SUP_S1_Q_NOT_EXISTENT.title: Step 1 — Support Item Not Existent
F4_SUP_S1_Q_NOT_EXISTENT.question: The process/procedure/item is not existent as required to support SUT operation and/or use.

F4_SUP_S1_DEG_SEVERELY.title: Severely Degraded Use of Support System/Item
F4_SUP_S1_DEG_SEVERELY.body: Severely degraded use of the support system/item.

F4_SUP_S1_Q_AVAIL_5_25.title: Step 1 — 5–25% Available/Developed/Fielded
F4_SUP_S1_Q_AVAIL_5_25.question: The process/procedure/item is 5–25% available/developed/fielded as required to support SUT operation and/or use.

F4_SUP_S1_DEG_CRITICALLY.title: Critically Degraded Use of Support System/Item
F4_SUP_S1_DEG_CRITICALLY.body: Critically degraded use of the support system/item.

F4_SUP_S1_Q_AVAIL_26_50.title: Step 1 — 26–50% Available/Developed/Fielded
F4_SUP_S1_Q_AVAIL_26_50.question: The process/procedure/item is 26–50% available/developed/fielded as required to support SUT operation and/or use.

F4_SUP_S1_DEG_SERIOUSLY.title: Seriously Degraded Use of Support System/Item
F4_SUP_S1_DEG_SERIOUSLY.body: Seriously degraded use of the support system/item.

F4_SUP_S1_Q_AVAIL_51_75.title: Step 1 — 51–75% Available/Developed/Fielded
F4_SUP_S1_Q_AVAIL_51_75.question: The process/procedure/item is 51–75% available/developed/fielded as required to support SUT operation and/or use.

F4_SUP_S1_DEG_MODERATELY.title: Moderately Degraded Use of Support System/Item
F4_SUP_S1_DEG_MODERATELY.body: Moderately degraded use of the support system/item.

F4_SUP_S1_Q_AVAIL_76_95.title: Step 1 — 76–95% Available/Developed/Fielded
F4_SUP_S1_Q_AVAIL_76_95.question: The process/procedure/item is 76–95% available/developed/fielded as required to support SUT operation and/or use.

F4_SUP_S1_DEG_MINOR.title: Minor Degraded Use of Support System/Item
F4_SUP_S1_DEG_MINOR.body: Minor degraded use of the support system/item.

F4_SUP_S2_Q_LIMITS_LE_15.title: Step 2 — Intended Use Limited (≤ 15%)
F4_SUP_S2_Q_LIMITS_LE_15.question: Deficiency precludes its intended use or limits intended use to ≤ 15% or only allows the operator/maintainer to execute/manage ≤ 15% of the intended use requirements and/or purpose.

F4_SUP_S2_Q_SUBSTITUTE_FOR_SEVERE.title: Substitute / Workaround Exists? (≤ 15%)
F4_SUP_S2_Q_SUBSTITUTE_FOR_SEVERE.question: Does a suitable substitute, workaround, procedure, or alternate means exist that allows the operator/maintainer to use the deficient support item? (Note 16)

F4_SUP_S2_Q_LIMITS_16_25.title: Step 2 — Intended Use Limited (16–25%)
F4_SUP_S2_Q_LIMITS_16_25.question: Deficiency limits intended use to 16–25% or only allows the operator/maintainer to execute/manage 16–25% of the intended use requirements and/or purpose.

F4_SUP_S2_Q_SUBSTITUTE_FOR_MAJOR1.title: Substitute / Workaround Exists? (16–25%)
F4_SUP_S2_Q_SUBSTITUTE_FOR_MAJOR1.question: Does a suitable substitute, workaround, procedure, or alternate means exist that allows the operator/maintainer to use the deficient support item? (Note 16)

F4_SUP_S2_Q_LIMITS_26_50.title: Step 2 — Intended Use Limited (26–50%)
F4_SUP_S2_Q_LIMITS_26_50.question: Deficiency limits intended use to 26–50% or only allows the operator/maintainer to execute/manage 26–50% of the intended use requirements and/or purpose.

F4_SUP_S2_Q_SUBSTITUTE_FOR_MAJOR2.title: Substitute / Workaround Exists? (26–50%)
F4_SUP_S2_Q_SUBSTITUTE_FOR_MAJOR2.question: Does a suitable substitute, workaround, procedure, or alternate means exist that allows the operator/maintainer to use the deficient support item? (Note 16)

F4_SUP_S2_Q_LIMITS_51_75.title: Step 2 — Intended Use Limited (51–75%)
F4_SUP_S2_Q_LIMITS_51_75.question: Deficiency limits intended use to 51–75% or only allows the operator/maintainer to execute/manage 51–75% of the intended use requirements and/or purpose.

F4_SUP_S2_Q_SUBSTITUTE_FOR_MAJOR3.title: Substitute / Workaround Exists? (51–75%)
F4_SUP_S2_Q_SUBSTITUTE_FOR_MAJOR3.question: Does a suitable substitute, workaround, procedure, or alternate means exist that allows the operator/maintainer to use the deficient support item? (Note 16)

F4_SUP_S2_Q_LIMITS_76_95.title: Step 2 — Intended Use Limited (76–95%)
F4_SUP_S2_Q_LIMITS_76_95.question: Deficiency limits intended use to 76–95% or only allows the operator/maintainer to execute/manage 76–95% of the intended use requirements and/or purpose.

F4_SUP_S2_Q_SUBSTITUTE_FOR_MINOR.title: Substitute / Workaround Exists? (76–95%)
F4_SUP_S2_Q_SUBSTITUTE_FOR_MINOR.question: Does a suitable substitute, workaround, procedure, or alternate means exist that allows the operator/maintainer to use the deficient support item? (Note 16)

F4_SUP_S2_Q_ALLOWS_ABOVE_96.title: Step 2 — Intended Use Above 96%
F4_SUP_S2_Q_ALLOWS_ABOVE_96.question: Deficiency allows intended use to above 96% or allows the operator/maintainer to execute/manage above 96% of the intended use requirements and/or purpose.

F4_SUP_S2_DEF_SEVERE.title: Severe Deficiency (Support Item)
F4_SUP_S2_DEF_SEVERE.body:
Severe Deficiency.

Correct prior to ship or system Deployment.

F4_SUP_S2_DEF_MAJOR1.title: Major 1 Deficiency (Support Item)
F4_SUP_S2_DEF_MAJOR1.body:
Major 1 Deficiency.

Correct prior to ship or system Deployment.
Correct prior to fleet introduction.

F4_SUP_S2_DEF_MAJOR2.title: Major 2 Deficiency (Support Item)
F4_SUP_S2_DEF_MAJOR2.body:
Major 2 Deficiency.

Correct prior to fleet introduction.
Correct prior to next program build/or software release.

F4_SUP_S2_DEF_MAJOR3.title: Major 3 Deficiency (Support Item)
F4_SUP_S2_DEF_MAJOR3.body:
Major 3 Deficiency.

Correct prior to next program build/or software release.
Correct as soon as possible.

F4_SUP_S2_DEF_MINOR.title: Minor Deficiency (Support Item)
F4_SUP_S2_DEF_MINOR.body:
Minor Deficiency.

Correct as soon as possible.
Correct as soon as practicable.

F4_S3_ENTRY_ROLLUP_SEVERE.title: Step 3 — Roll-up Assessment Entry
F4_S3_ENTRY_ROLLUP_SEVERE.body: If there are multiple similar/related deficiencies on the same equipment/system/subsystem, evaluate combined effect to determine whether a roll-up is appropriate.

F4_S3_ENTRY_ROLLUP_MAJOR1.title: Step 3 — Roll-up Assessment Entry (Major 1)
F4_S3_ENTRY_ROLLUP_MAJOR1.body: Proceed to roll-up assessment for an existing Major 1 deficiency (if applicable).

F4_S3_ENTRY_ROLLUP_MAJOR2.title: Step 3 — Roll-up Assessment Entry (Major 2)
F4_S3_ENTRY_ROLLUP_MAJOR2.body: Proceed to roll-up assessment for an existing Major 2 deficiency (if applicable).

F4_S3_ENTRY_ROLLUP_MAJOR3.title: Step 3 — Roll-up Assessment Entry (Major 3)
F4_S3_ENTRY_ROLLUP_MAJOR3.body: Proceed to roll-up assessment for an existing Major 3 deficiency (if applicable).

F4_S3_ENTRY_ROLLUP_MINOR.title: Step 3 — Roll-up Assessment Entry (Minor)
F4_S3_ENTRY_ROLLUP_MINOR.body: Proceed to roll-up assessment for an existing Minor deficiency (if applicable).

F4_S3_ENTRY_ROLLUP_NONE.title: Step 3 — Roll-up Assessment Entry (No Deficiency)
F4_S3_ENTRY_ROLLUP_NONE.body: Proceed to roll-up assessment for an existing No Deficiency support-item call (if applicable).

F4_S3_Q_ROLLUP_NEEDED_GENERIC.title: Roll-up Needed?
F4_S3_Q_ROLLUP_NEEDED_GENERIC.question: Are there multiple (similar/related) deficiencies on the same equipment/system/subsystem that should be assessed together for a potential roll-up?

F4_S3_Q_HAS_2PLUS_FOR_MAJOR1.title: Major 1 — Related Deficiencies Present?
F4_S3_Q_HAS_2PLUS_FOR_MAJOR1.question: Are there two or more other Major 1, 2, 3, or Minor Deficiencies that are on/related to the existing Major 1 deficiency?

F4_S3_Q_HAS_2PLUS_FOR_MAJOR2.title: Major 2 — Related Deficiencies Present?
F4_S3_Q_HAS_2PLUS_FOR_MAJOR2.question: Are there two or more other Major 2, 3, or Minor Deficiencies that are on/related to the existing Major 2 deficiency?

F4_S3_Q_HAS_2PLUS_FOR_MAJOR3.title: Major 3 — Related Deficiencies Present?
F4_S3_Q_HAS_2PLUS_FOR_MAJOR3.question: Are there two or more other Major 3, or Minor Deficiencies that are on/related to the existing Major 3 deficiency?

F4_S3_Q_HAS_2PLUS_FOR_MINOR.title: Minor — Related Deficiencies Present?
F4_S3_Q_HAS_2PLUS_FOR_MINOR.question: Are there two or more other Minor or No Deficiencies that are on/related to the existing Minor deficiency?

F4_S3_Q_HAS_2PLUS_FOR_NONE.title: No Deficiency — Related Deficiencies Present?
F4_S3_Q_HAS_2PLUS_FOR_NONE.question: Are there two or more other Minor or No Deficiencies that are on/related to the existing No Deficiency call?

F4_S3_INFO_EVAL_COMBINED_EFFECT.title: Evaluate Combined Effect
F4_S3_INFO_EVAL_COMBINED_EFFECT.body: Evaluate the effect the combined deficiencies have on the operator/maintainer's ability to execute/manage the intended use/requirements and/or purpose to determine the combined rating.

F4_S3_Q_COMBINED_76_95.title: Combined Rating — 76–95%
F4_S3_Q_COMBINED_76_95.question: Combined Deficiency limits intended use to between 76–95% or allows the operator/maintainer to execute/manage between 76–95% of the intended use requirements and/or purpose.

F4_S3_Q_COMBINED_51_75.title: Combined Rating — 51–75%
F4_S3_Q_COMBINED_51_75.question: Combined Deficiency limits intended use to between 51–75% or allows the operator/maintainer to execute/manage between 51–75% of the intended use requirements and/or purpose.

F4_S3_Q_COMBINED_26_50.title: Combined Rating — 26–50%
F4_S3_Q_COMBINED_26_50.question: Combined Deficiency limits intended use to between 26–50% or allows the operator/maintainer to execute/manage between 26–50% of the intended use requirements and/or purpose.

F4_S3_Q_COMBINED_16_25.title: Combined Rating — 16–25%
F4_S3_Q_COMBINED_16_25.question: Combined Deficiency limits intended use to between 16–25% or allows the operator/maintainer to execute/manage between 16–25% of the intended use requirements and/or purpose.

F4_S3_Q_COMBINED_LE_15.title: Combined Rating — ≤ 15%
F4_S3_Q_COMBINED_LE_15.question: Combined Deficiency precludes its intended use or limits intended use to ≤ 15% or only allows the operator/maintainer to execute/manage ≤ 15% of the intended use requirements and/or purpose.

F4_S3_OUTCOME_LEAVE_SEPARATE.title: Leave as Separate Deficiencies
F4_S3_OUTCOME_LEAVE_SEPARATE.body: Based on the combined rating, leave these deficiencies as separate calls (no roll-up).

F4_S3_OUTCOME_ROLLUP_MAJOR3.title: Major 3 Deficiency Roll-Up
F4_S3_OUTCOME_ROLLUP_MAJOR3.body: Roll up the related deficiencies to a single Major 3 deficiency.

F4_S3_OUTCOME_ROLLUP_MAJOR2.title: Major 2 Deficiency Roll-Up
F4_S3_OUTCOME_ROLLUP_MAJOR2.body: Roll up the related deficiencies to a single Major 2 deficiency.

F4_S3_OUTCOME_ROLLUP_MAJOR1.title: Major 1 Deficiency Roll-Up
F4_S3_OUTCOME_ROLLUP_MAJOR1.body: Roll up the related deficiencies to a single Major 1 deficiency.

F4_S3_OUTCOME_ROLLUP_SEVERE.title: Severe Deficiency Roll-Up
F4_S3_OUTCOME_ROLLUP_SEVERE.body: Roll up the related deficiencies to a single Severe deficiency.

F4_END_FINAL.title: Outcome: Figure 4 Complete
F4_END_FINAL.body: Figure 4 quantitative baseline assessment is complete.
